MajorClaims.MC1: being a citizen involves in a number of duties, other than paying taxes

Claims.C1: People in society must do more than paying taxes to contribute to their society
Claims.C2: they have fulfilled their duty as a citizen
Claims.C3: individuals of a country are responsible for many other things apart from paying tax

Premises.P1: If people are paying taxes, that means they are taking part in the development of their country as well as the country's economy
Premises.P2: Taxes are the income for every country in the world and they are extremely important for developing countries
Premises.P3: the crime rate is reduced and society becomes a peaceful place, so the country will develop at a rapid pace
Premises.P4: in order to develop a country, citizens must obey laws, which were imposed by the government
Premises.P5: being a citizen in society should protect the country's culture and history
Premises.P6: people should have knowledge about their own culture and history by studying at school with full concentration or reading them from books
Premises.P7: a person has to unite with other people in the community so as to develop their nation
Premises.P8: if people in society have a strong bond with each other, society will become a peaceful place, where people are helping and sharing to each other
